question:
What is the most transmissible bacteria that has infected humans?


A) Bordetella pertussis
B) Streptococcus pneumoniae
C) Corynebacterium diphtheriae
D) Tuberculosis

What type of immunity drives the evolution of pertactin-deficient Bordetella pertussis strains?


A) Mucosal immunity
B) Naturainfection immunity
C) Innate immunity
D) Vaccine-induced immunity

What type of pathogen is Bordetella pertussis?


A) Fungus
B) Protozoa
C) Bacterium
D) Virus

Which of the following are not a component of common acellular Bordetella pertussis vaccines?


A) Fimbral proteins
B) Lipopolysaccharide
C) Pertactin
D) Filamentous haemagglutinin

Which of the following is a major effect of the pertussis toxin that contributes to the pathogenesis of whooping cough?


A) Suppresses the host immune response
B) Stimulates production of immunoglobulin E
C) Promotes coughing fits through inflammatio
D) Inhibits ciliary action in the airways
choices: Inhibits ciliary action in the airways

question:
Which of the following is NOT considered a virulence factor of Bordetella pertussis?


A) Adenylate cyclase toxin
B) Pertussis toxin
C) Filamentous hemagglutinin
D) Capsulapolysaccharide

Which of the following statements is supported by the literature about B. pertussis?


A) Acellular vaccines have increased the stability of key antigenic components.
B) Vaccinations have resulted in changes to B. pertussis that have reduced vaccine efficacy.
C) The acellular vaccine period led to more mutations in B. pertussis than the whole cell vaccine period.
D) An accumulation of mutations in vaccine antigen genes has led to greater vaccine efficacy.
choices: Acellular vaccines have increased the stability of key antigenic components.
Vaccinations have resulted in changes to B. pertussis that have reduced vaccine efficacy.
The acellular vaccine period led to more mutations in B. pertussis than the whole cell vaccine period.
An accumulation of mutations in vaccine antigen genes has led to greater vaccine efficacy.

question:
Which process allows pertussis strains to evade vaccine immunity over time?


A) Phase variation
B) Horizontal gene transfer
C) Plasmid acquisition
D) Antigenic drift

Which stage of pertussis involves fits of rapid, violent coughing?


A) Catarrhal
B) Chronic
C) Paroxysmal
D) Convalescent

Which toxin impairs the immune response against B. pertussis?


A) Tracheal cytotoxin
B) Lipopolysaccharide
C) Pertussis toxin
D) Adenylate cyclase toxin

Which virulence factor helps B. pertussis adhere to respiratory epithelium?


A) Tracheal cytotoxin
B) Adenylate cyclase toxin
C) Filamentous hemagglutinin
D) Pertussis toxin
